text: <!channel>: hey team, I’m working on drafting up some responses to the feedback. Mostly high level, but once I’m finished, I’ll share internally so we can talk about how we want to move forward.
sounds good
<@U026PLK4S> if you're planning on sharing somewhere other than slack, can you include me in it too?
Same here
great - thanks matt!
is there any benefit to getting together as a group and going through their feedback?
that seems wise
i’ll put something on the calendar
<@U02613K0X> <@U02618EV1> do you two want to be in that?
agreed

<@U04JZANJF> sure. I don't think I'll be needed for most of it, but there are a couple of things they want in particular I'm interested in, like map navigation and choosing different layouts for each photo page.
I agree ^^

honestly, i’d rather not respond to each item, line by line, but instead try respond with a larger point of view. I think a lot of this stuff boils down to a handful of themes.  Scale, Type, Color, Layout. Working on that now.
totally agree
I think some of their ideas are probably totally fine, but a few of them I’d like to push on a little by going further into our thought process
sorry - just logging in and seeing this. I'm in particular in agreement with the last two things here.
One early thought i have is that we should indeed take them up on the time they discussed to talk together — whatever that conversation needs to be
yeah - for sure
also, Gaston’s code pen example may be a great thing to share
agreed
not as solution, per se, but as a “here’s what we’re up against"
yeah - I think that’s a good call
One thing to keep in mind with these comments — I believe Susan is at least part of the voice here. And I can say with authority that she's not super well-versed in web, much less responsive web
kicking ass in battlefields, yes.
but i think some comments just need additional context from us
today, i think it may be worth some of my time drumming up an alternate photo+caption layout
just to see what happens
agreed
i think alternate layouts are an interesting idea, esp looking at some of their content…
<@U0260V1BX|melissa> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F073AA7CL/screen_shot_2015-07-01_at_11.02.17_am.png|Screen Shot 2015-07-01 at 11.02.17 AM.png>
captions mean more in some projects than they do in others
what do you mean, alternate for projects or for aspect ratios within projects

not sure, maybe both. i think that if there are slides where the caption is very important to the slide, maybe there’s a layout that honors the caption more, and maybe there is a layout that minimizes it to more of a byline. Just thinking out loud here.

well, one thing that is interesting from the feedback, is that the captions — even the longer ones — aren’t as important to the story as maybe we thought they were. Ewald and I sat in front of my computer one morning and had this same discussion. We thought that they were super important, so we didn’t want them jumping around. This changes that a bit by unlocking a constraint.

Personally - i still don’t love the idea of stuff jumping around on the page - regardless of its importance. I think the stillness of the current slideshow layout is one of the things that lends to its calm feeling and adds to gravity of the photography.
That said - I agree that it’s probably worth further consideration around captions
That’s a much better way to put it.
:simple_smile:

<@U026PLK4S> I agree with the push-back / work-with division in your feedback email - thanks for writing that up . One thing that I read differently from their email — I think that their 4 “proposed formats” were 4 different forms that they can see these projects taking in the future, and therefore that we should design for. Did anyone else take it that way?
like, maybe next year one of the artists just makes a short film.
honestly - I need to sit down with their feedback for longer than I’ve had time to. I’ll be sure to dig into it for real before our meeting though
oh interesting...

we’ll definitely allow for photo vs video, slideshow, but i think their comment about adding a “text slide” or a “text plus image” slide is interesting… and kind of puts me back at wanting them to go vertical. but whatever.
haha
i think that will be an edge case
that we can make look beautiful within the current model
and that's one aspect i'm hoping to shape with them
we focus on core cases now
vs. build everything that, to their point about color, will also further complicate CMS (e.g. layout options)
anyway - we'll talk
i think we're on a good trajectory though
but overall it sounds like there’s a desire to control emphasis on text. whether it’s “caption vs description or what.
AND - they wrote to us last night to discuss yet another Magnum project. So I think we're doing just fine.
NICE
<@U026PLK4S> i’m doing some thinking about navigation / map UX  - not sure if you’ve thought about it at all but we should maybe hit up a whiteboard this afternoon if you’ve got time.
sure thing. Down to help however you’d want me
i’m gonna pop into glass
oh, i thought you meant this afternoon. i just started cooking on photo layout stuff

if possible - I’d love to take a little time you guys - <@U026PLK4S> and <@U0260V1BX> - after our group meeting today to look at what we have vs. whatever the outcome of our talk is - from a design/IA perspective
Im not sure what your afternoons like post- that meeting
sure thing
wanted to get some things on the board while they were fresh in my mind - lets chat about em later
Let’s talk more about this at three, but wanted to get this up so people can start to look and digest a bit before.
<https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/5rar3xay44yc491/2cfp6e75.png>
awesome
nice
switching caption layouts can add a bit more photo real estate, but the differences aren’t really as crazy as you’d expect, except in extremes
right - the super long
it does help overall though in terms of that photo size
esp. if their team can edit down those captions
to make it less extreme
gaston’s photo experiment is already doing some of this “within” the photo safe zone, the captions are just another wrinkle that make your head spin a bit
also, its interesting to note that caption layouts don’t play that big of a role in how big photos are, browser aspect vs photo aspect is where it’s at.
this also feels like one of those times when the devs are probably snickering at how hard of a time us designers are having with this
hahaha
well - this is all important to think through though
knowing what we know/what we don't exactly know yet
I was more thinking I'm glad that I'm not the one who really has to think this stuff through right now
<http://www.quickmeme.com/img/d1/d1740c7c7b38d898327c02165d028be97edb24519b268091034940c6949575c4.jpg>
haha
not sure how i didn’t notice this before, but we only have photos for 8 projects on NAS. There are 9 total, right?
there will be yes
they know theres one missing
ok
let’s meet in glass when you’re ready
